definitions: informal term for a person from Britain or the United Kingdom
examples: Several Brits joined our tour group in Paris
The pub was filled with expat Brits watching football

definitions: hard material that breaks easily without bending or deforming
hard candy made with sugar and nuts that breaks into pieces
examples: The ancient parchment had become brittle with age
Brittle plastic cracks easily under cold temperatures
She brought homemade peanut brittle to the holiday party
The brittle shattered into delicious caramel pieces

definitions: sharp pointed tool for making holes or opening casks
decorative pin or clasp worn as jewelry on clothing
examples: The cooper used a broach to tap the wine barrel
He carefully inserted the broach into the wooden cask
She wore an antique silver broach on her lapel
The Victorian broach featured intricate floral engravings

definitions: expanse or extent that is notably wide or extensive
dated slang term for a woman, now considered offensive
examples: The broad of his shoulders indicated his athletic build
They surveyed the broad of the valley below
The old detective novel used 'broad' to describe female characters
Using 'broad' for women is considered disrespectful today

definitions: program or information transmitted by radio or television to the public
act of scattering seeds or material over a wide area
examples: The evening broadcast featured breaking news from overseas
They interrupted regular broadcast for an emergency announcement
The farmer's broadcast of seeds covered the entire field
The broadcast method ensures even distribution of fertilizer

definitions: person or organization that transmits programs on radio or television
machine or device that scatters seeds or materials widely
examples: The broadcaster announced the election results live on air
Major broadcasters compete for exclusive interview rights
The mechanical broadcaster spread grass seed across the lawn
Modern broadcasters can distribute fertilizer with precise control

definitions: business or activity of transmitting programs via radio or television
act or process of scattering materials over a wide area
examples: She studied broadcasting at the communications college
Digital broadcasting has revolutionized how we consume media
Broadcasting wildflower seeds creates a natural meadow effect
The broadcasting of pesticides requires careful weather monitoring

definitions: process of becoming wider or more extensive in scope or range
examples: The broadening of her expertise included several new fields
Market broadening strategies helped the company reach new customers

definitions: large-format newspaper printed on full-size paper pages, typically associated with serious journalism
examples: The broadsheet covered international affairs in comprehensive detail
Many broadsheets have switched to smaller formats for convenience

definitions: simultaneous firing of all guns on one side of a warship
large sheet of paper printed on one side with information
harsh verbal attack or strong public criticism
examples: The frigate delivered a devastating broadside to the enemy vessel
Historical naval battles often began with massive broadsides
Political broadsides were posted throughout the colonial town
The broadside announced the new tax regulations
The senator launched a broadside against the proposed legislation
Her editorial was a broadside attacking corporate greed

definitions: rich fabric woven with raised patterns, typically using gold or silver threads
examples: The wedding dress featured panels of ivory brocade
Antique brocade curtains adorned the palace windows

definitions: edible green plant with flowering head of small buds eaten as vegetable
examples: Steamed broccoli makes a nutritious side dish
The children reluctantly ate their broccoli at dinner

definitions: small booklet or pamphlet containing promotional or informational material about products or services
examples: The travel brochure showcased tropical destination packages
She collected university brochures from the college fair

definitions: heating element in an oven used for direct high-temperature cooking
young chicken raised specifically for meat production
examples: Set the broiler to high for perfectly crispy cheese
The broiler quickly caramelized the sugar topping
The farm raises thousands of broilers every month
Broiler chickens reach market weight in just six weeks

definitions: person who arranges transactions between buyers and sellers for a commission
person who negotiates agreements between different parties
examples: The stock broker executed trades worth millions daily
She hired a real estate broker to sell her property
The peace broker facilitated discussions between opposing factions
He acted as a power broker in political negotiations

definitions: business or firm that acts as intermediary in financial transactions
fee or commission charged by a broker for services
examples: The brokerage handled investments for wealthy clients nationwide
She opened an account with an online brokerage
The brokerage on that transaction was five percent
High brokerage fees can significantly reduce investment returns

definitions: compound containing bromine combined with another element or radical
overused saying or cliché that lacks originality
examples: Silver bromide is used in photographic film processing
The doctor prescribed potassium bromide for seizure control
His speech was filled with tired bromides about success
The consultant offered nothing but corporate bromides

definitions: dark reddish-brown liquid chemical element with atomic number 35, highly reactive halogen
examples: Bromine vapor has a sharp, unpleasant odor
The chemistry lab stored bromine in sealed glass containers

definitions: untamed or partially tamed horse, especially one used in rodeo events
examples: The cowboy struggled to stay on the bucking bronc
Several broncs escaped from the rodeo holding pen

definitions: untamed or partially broken horse of western North America, often used in rodeos
examples: The bronco threw three riders during the competition
Wild broncos still roam parts of the American West

definitions: alloy of copper and tin used for tools, weapons, and art
medal awarded for third place in a competition
moderate yellowish to olive brown color
examples: The ancient bronze statue had developed a green patina
Bronze tools revolutionized early human civilization
She proudly displayed her Olympic bronze on the mantle
The team celebrated winning bronze at the championships
The sunset painted the sky in shades of bronze
Her skin had a beautiful bronze glow from the summer sun

definitions: ornamental piece of jewelry with a pin for attaching to clothing
examples: Her grandmother's diamond brooch sparkled on her dress
The vintage brooch featured hand-painted enamel flowers

definitions: family of young birds or animals produced at one hatching or birth
state of deep thought often with worry or gloom
examples: The hen protected her brood of twelve chicks
A brood of ducklings followed their mother across the pond
His dark brood lasted through the rainy afternoon
She fell into a melancholy brood after the news

definitions: deep, often melancholic contemplation or worried thought
act of sitting on eggs to incubate them
examples: His brooding over past mistakes consumed his evenings
The artist's brooding produced deeply emotional paintings
The hen's brooding would continue for three weeks
Brooding behavior is instinctive in most bird species

definitions: female horse kept specifically for breeding purposes to produce offspring
examples: The champion broodmare produced several Derby winners
Quality broodmares are essential for successful horse breeding programs

definitions: small natural stream of fresh water, smaller than a river
examples: Children played beside the babbling brook all afternoon
The brook meandered through the meadow toward the lake

definitions: long-handled brush used for sweeping floors and surfaces
shrub with yellow flowers and slender green stems
examples: She grabbed the broom to sweep the kitchen floor
The old broom shed bristles with every stroke
Wild broom covered the hillside in bright yellow blooms
Scottish broom is considered invasive in some regions

definitions: long thin handle of a broom, often associated with witches in folklore
examples: The witch flew away on her magical broomstick
He used the broken broomstick as a makeshift walking cane

definitions: thin soup made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water
examples: Chicken broth forms the base of many soups
She sipped warm vegetable broth to soothe her throat

definitions: establishment where people engage in sexual activity with prostitutes for payment
examples: Historical records mention brothels in the old port district
The authorities closed several illegal brothels last year

definitions: male person who shares one or both parents with another
male member of a religious order or congregation
close male friend or comrade, especially in a shared cause
examples: My older brother teaches at the local high school
The two brothers inherited their father's business
Brother Francis tended the monastery garden with devotion
The brothers gathered for evening prayers
We've been brothers in arms since basic training
Hey brother, thanks for having my back

definitions: relationship between brothers or feeling of kinship with fellow humans
organization or association of men with common interests or goals
state of being united in a common purpose or fellowship
examples: The brotherhood between the siblings remained strong despite distance
He felt a deep brotherhood with his fellow veterans
The brotherhood meets every month to discuss community service
He joined the firefighters' brotherhood after graduation
The team developed a true brotherhood through shared challenges
They preached universal brotherhood among all peoples

definitions: forehead or the area above the eyes including the eyebrows
summit or upper edge of a hill or slope
examples: Sweat dripped from his brow during the intense workout
She furrowed her brow in deep concentration
They reached the brow of the hill at sunset
From the brow, they could see the valley below

definitions: color produced by mixing red, yellow, and black, as of wood or earth
examples: The rich brown of the leather sofa complemented the décor
Autumn leaves turned various shades of brown and gold

definitions: square piece of rich chocolate cake, often containing nuts
member of the youngest group of Girl Guides or Girl Scouts
helpful household sprite or elf in Scottish and English folklore
examples: She baked fudge brownies for the school bake sale
The brownies were still warm from the oven
The brownie troop sold cookies to raise funds
She earned her first badge as a brownie
Legend says brownies help with household chores at night
The cottage brownie was said to bring good fortune

definitions: process of food becoming brown through cooking, especially via the Maillard reaction
gradual change to brown color through aging, exposure, or chemical reaction
examples: The browning of the meat adds rich flavor to the stew
Proper browning creates a delicious crust on bread
The browning of the old photograph made faces hard to distinguish
Enzymatic browning turns cut apples brown quickly

definitions: row house faced with reddish-brown sandstone, common in older American cities
type of reddish-brown sandstone used as a building material
examples: They renovated a nineteenth-century brownstone in Brooklyn
The brownstone had four floors and original details
The quarry supplied brownstone for many historic buildings
Brownstone facades require regular maintenance and sealing

definitions: act of looking through or glancing at casually
examples: A quick browse through the magazine revealed interesting articles
His browse of the bookstore lasted over an hour

definitions: computer program used to navigate and access information on the internet
person who looks casually through items without specific intent to buy
examples: The browser crashed while loading the complex webpage
She updated her browser to the latest version
Several browsers examined the antiques without purchasing anything
The bookstore welcomed browsers and serious buyers alike

definitions: act of looking through items or information casually without specific purpose
feeding on leaves, young shoots, or other vegetation
examples: Browsing through vintage shops became her weekend hobby
Online browsing can lead to unexpected discoveries
Deer browsing had damaged the young saplings
Browsing animals help maintain grassland ecosystems

definitions: name for a bear, especially in children's stories and folklore
examples: The old bruin emerged from hibernation in early spring
Local legends spoke of a giant bruin in the mountains

definitions: discolored area on skin caused by blood from damaged vessels beneath
area of damage or discoloration on fruit or plant tissue
examples: The bruise on her arm turned purple after the fall
Ice helps reduce swelling around a fresh bruise
The bruise on the apple made it unsuitable for sale
Handle peaches carefully to avoid bruise marks

definitions: large, strong, and aggressive person, typically one who fights
examples: The bouncer was a real bruiser who kept troublemakers away
Despite being a bruiser, he had a gentle nature

definitions: late morning meal combining breakfast and lunch, typically eaten on weekends
examples: Sunday brunch at the hotel includes champagne and pastries
They met for brunch at their favorite café

definitions: man or boy with dark brown or black hair
examples: The tall brunet caught everyone's attention at the party
He was a handsome brunet with Mediterranean features

definitions: woman or girl with dark brown or black hair
examples: The brunette actress won the leading role
She dyed her hair from blonde to become a brunette

definitions: main force or impact of something unpleasant or harmful
examples: Coastal towns bore the brunt of the hurricane's damage
She took the brunt of criticism for the team's failure

definitions: implement with bristles used for cleaning, grooming, or painting
dense vegetation consisting of shrubs and small trees
brief encounter or slight contact with something
technique or instance of applying paint
examples: She used a soft brush to style her hair
The paint brush needed thorough cleaning after use
Firefighters cleared brush to create a firebreak
Dense brush made hiking difficult
His brush with fame came during his college years
A brush with death changed his perspective on life
The artist's brush technique created beautiful textures
Each brush stroke was deliberate and meaningful

definitions: act of using a brush for cleaning, grooming, or painting
act of making light contact while passing
examples: Daily brushing keeps your teeth healthy and clean
The horse enjoyed its morning brushing
The brushing of leaves against the window woke her
A gentle brushing of hands conveyed unspoken affection

definitions: broken or cut branches and twigs from trees and bushes
examples: They gathered brushwood to build a small fire
The fence was woven from dried brushwood
